content.title: Mukhyamantri Kanya Vivaah / Nikaah Yojana
content.details: Madhya Pradesh State Government started 'Mukhyamantri Kanya Vivaah Yojana' with the objective to provide financial assistance to needy girls/widows (Kalyani)/abandoned sisters at the time of their marriage.
benefits: Amount: Rs. 6,000/- per girl, to the mass marriage organizing body.
eligibility: The guardian of the bride/groom should be a native of Madhya Pradesh.
The bride has completed the prescribed age for marriage (At present, the minimum legal age for marriage for a girl is 18 years and the minimum legal age for a man is 21 years).
Abandoned women who have been legally divorced.

There will be no restriction on income for the beneficiary to get assistance under the scheme, but it will be necessary that the beneficiary should get his marriage done only by participating in the group marriage program to be organized on the scheduled dates. In case of a single marriage, the benefit of the scheme will not be available.
content.application_process: Offline. Applicants have to visit Gram Panchayat/Janpad Panchyat for rural Areas and Nagar Nigam/Nagar Panchayat/Nagar Parishad for urban areas. Applicants have to get the application form and fill out the application form with the required information. Applicants have to submit the application form along with all the necessary documents to the below offices: Gram Panchayat/Janpad Panchyat for rural areas. Nagar Nigam/Nagar Panchayat/Nagar Parishad for urban areas.

faqs.question: What is this scheme?
faqs.answer: In 2006, Madhya Pradesh State Government started the 'Mukhyamantri Kanya Vivaah Yojana' for females/girls.

faqs.question: What are the benefits?
faqs.answer: Provide financial assistance to the Bride.

faqs.question: What Is Eligible Age of the Bride?
faqs.answer: The bride has to complete the prescribed age for marriage (At present, the minimum legal age for marriage for a girl is 18 years).

faqs.question: What Is Eligible Age Of The groom?
faqs.answer: The groom has to Completed The Prescribed Age For Marriage (At Present, The Minimum Legal Age For Marriage For A groom Is 21 Years).

faqs.question: Can Abandoned women apply?
faqs.answer: Yes, but Abandoned women have been legally divorced.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for rural areas?
faqs.answer: No, this is applicable to urban and rural both.

faqs.question: What is the financial eligibility criteria?
faqs.answer: There will be no restriction on income for the beneficiary to get assistance under the scheme.

faqs.question: Can men also take benefits of this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, this is only for girls/women/brides.

faqs.question: What documents are required while submitting the application form?
faqs.answer: Aadhaar Card of the applicant, Voter ID Card, Passport-size photo, Mobile number.

faqs.question: How to apply?
faqs.answer: Applicants have to visit Gram Panchayat/Janpad Panchyat for rural areas and Visit Nagar Nigam/Nagar Panchayat/Nagar Parishad for urban areas.
